reference.shortdesc: An index-see-also element within an indexterm redirects the reader to another index entry that the reader should reference in addition to the current one.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: In addition to its "see also" redirection, an index-see-also functions as a pointwise index term, thereby typically generating a page reference as well as the "see also" indication.
It is not an error for there to be multiple index-see-also elements for a single index entry.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: and keyref.
